prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 and a translation vector of 0.0, 0.0, 0.0. 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create loop 1 of the sketch with the following curves: - Line 1: Start Point at (0.0, 0.0), End Point at (0.3333, 0.0) - Line 2: Start Point at (0.3333, 0.0), End Point at (0.3333, 0.3333) - Line 3: Start Point at (0.3333, 0.3333), End Point at (0.0, 0.3333) - Line 4: Start Point at (0.0, 0.3333), End Point at (0.0, 0.0) 4. Close the loop and ensure it is fully constrained. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.3333 using the sketch scaling parameter. 6. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the sketch by 0.5 units along the normal. Part 2: Construct a cylindrical object with a tapered top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles of 0.0, 0.0, and 0.0 and a translation vector of (0.1333, 0.1333, 0.5). 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on face 1 of the coordinate system. 3. Create loop 1 of the sketch with the following curves: - Circle 1: Center at (0.0333, 0.0333), Radius of 0.0333 4. Close the loop and ensure it is fully constrained. 5. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.0667 using the sketch scaling parameter. 6. Transform the 2D sketch into 3D using the Euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system. 7. Extrude the sketch by 0.25 units along the normal. Final shape: A rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole at one end. 1. Combine Part 1 and Part 2 using a "JoinFeatureOperation". 2. Machine a cylindrical hole through Part 1 that matches the dimensions of Part 2. 3. Final shape is complete with the dimensions of 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. The cylindrical hole has a diameter of 0.0667 units and a depth of 0.25 units.</description>

</json>

The sides are parallel and meet at right angles, and the dimensions are 2 units by 3 units by 4 units. 1. **Create a new coordinate system for the part.** - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.375, 0.0] 2. **Draw the 2D sketch on a plane defined by the coordinate system.** 2.1. Create a face (face\\_1) and draw the first line (line\\_1) on the face with the following points: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.0] - End Point: [0.375, 0.0] 2.2. From the endpoint of line\\_1, draw the second line (line\\_2) with the following points: - Start Point: [0.375, 0.0] - End Point: [0.375, 0.0059] 2.3. From the endpoint of line\\_2, draw the third line (line\\_3) with the following points: - Start Point: [0.375, 0.0059] - End Point: [0.0, 0.0059] 2.4. From the endpoint of line\\_3, draw the fourth line (line\\_4) to close the loop, with the following points: - Start Point: [0.0, 0.0059] - End Point: [0.0, 0.0] 3. **Scale the 2D sketch (sketch\\_scale: 0.375).** 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system.** 5. **Extrude the sketch to generate the 3D model.** - Extrude depth towards the normal: 0.1875 - Extrude depth opposite to the normal: 0.1875 The resulting prism has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.375 - Width: 0.375 - Height: 0.375</description>
